meanings.definition: Syncopators: People who play syncopated rhythms.
meanings.sent1: The syncopators in the band added a unique beat to the music.
meanings.sent2: The syncopators at the jazz club kept the audience dancing all night.
meanings.sent3: The syncopators decided to switch up the rhythm and surprise everyone.
meanings.sent4: The syncopators were like musical magicians, weaving intricate beats together.
meanings.sent5: The syncopators' rhythms were like a secret code that only they could decipher.

meanings.definition: Syncopators: A group of musicians who specialize in syncopated music.
meanings.sent1: We could hear the syncopators practicing in the studio next door.
meanings.sent2: The syncopators performed at the festival and wowed the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The syncopators joked that their music could make even a robot dance.
meanings.sent4: The syncopators' melodies intertwined like a beautiful dance on stage.
meanings.sent5: The syncopators' music was a vibrant tapestry of sound that captivated listeners.
